38332837.review:
Ah ce jeux , que de souvenirs ( et des bons ..... ) du coup mon avis risque d'etre biaisé, arf tant pis.

Bon jeux de gestion ( de ville ), les bases sont assez facile à prendre en mains et les différents sénarios de base risques de poser probleme au joueurs les plus casual ( pour les personnes interesser par plus de challenge il existe encore aujourd'hui une bonne communauté qui a créer des scénarios assez ... hardu ( ou putassier ) aàvous de choisir ).

La difficulté change les prix des batiments et des charges courantes de la cité ( salaire/taxe/... ),  la durée de vie est assez élevée ( voir tres importante), l'humour est présent dans tous le jeux ( nom de certains citoyens/ scene de la vie courante dans la cité). 

Pour moi les deux seul bémol seraient les graphiques qui ont mal vieillis ( hein ? quoi le jeux à plus de 10 ans ??? , je deviens vieux) , et le fait que le jeux sois en anglais ( il doit exister un patch Fr a ajouter sois meme , encore fait il le faire).


Sur ce, j'ai une hydre à déssouder.

38147402.review:
十幾年前的經典城市經營遊戲，市區規劃、人民稅收調動、物資生產管理，至貿易經營與外交，讓人難以想像其為2000年出現的遊戲
不僅如此，故事內容含有大量希臘神話經典廣為人知的事件作為故事主體，在城市經營之下還可以看見奧林帕斯諸神走在自己苦心經營的城市街道上，甚至是宣傳自己的神格好讓玩家們選擇建造此神的神殿，不禁讓人對莊嚴的神明感到些許的逗趣親近感。
除此之外還存在著敵對神的攻擊以及神話中的怪物攻擊你的城市使你措手不及，迫切的希望傲慢的英雄早日抵達你的城市整治怪物、已建造神殿的友好神對付敵對神的破壞。

推薦尋找古早城市經營遊戲的玩家們亦或是喜歡希臘神話的玩家們。…亦或是…尋找童年PC遊戲回憶的朋友們。

35925373.review:
I used to play this game for days on end as a kid. I really had no idea what I was doing other than building pretty cities and fighting mytical monsters, but it was so addictive. As I got older I graduated to Civ and forgot about this game in leiu of FPS and other such games.  I always did kept an eye out for it on disc though...just in case. I never thought it would appear on Steam. Then low and behold here it is. 

This game is very addictive, it is a city builder but set in ancient Greece and populated with very active gods from the mythology of the time. Each chapter poses its own challenges and some are harder than others. 

Very fun game, especially for the nostalgia.

35847445.review:
I've easily put hundreds apon hundreds of hours into this game when i was a child
And this is almost exactly like how i played it years ago and that is a good and bad fact

This game is a great city builder, a classic in its own right
If you enjoyed this game years ago get it now (WHEN ITS ON SALE)

I can only recommend it when its on sale, all activision did was put it on steam as is...
NO FIXES 
New and old bugs here and there
All they had to do was take an unlucky intern put him infront of a PC and just say 
"Fix as much as you can"
And it would probably be a day or two work just to fix the obviouse bugs

Problems you will find...
-Some Gods have slow animations <Activision should have fixed this>
-Its hard to know which part of the map you can't build on sometimes <Original Release>
-I have heard many people have a resolution problems, so just lookout <Activision should have fixed this>
-Game not starting <Activision should have fixed this>
-The AI... its old AI its really unforgiving <Original Release >
(Having a perfect set of houses then all of a sudden they devolve because the peddler or waterbearers decided to change route!!! i hope one day they remaster the game and let us choose there routes)

All in all its the same game from many years ago just with a few more bugs
8/10 buy when on sale
 
I have found some fixes to the start up bug
+Disable GForce Experiance Overlay(Fixed my problem)
+Delete Binks Files
+Change Resolution via steam or graphics card
If these fixes don't work just browse Google and some forums for other fixes, the GOG version seems to have the same problems.

34552469.review:
Master of Olympus: Zeus and Poseidon is one of those 'cult-classics' that I came to love during my younger years when it was out in the market years ago. Mythology and history-focus is what made the game very interesting to play. Some of its episodes demands more of the player from thinking wide to even wider to build an ever-lasting city worthy of the Gods (in this case mine was Ares). Despite it's out-of-date graphics, it did provide a satisfying play and some time made you feel "Let's have another go". 

7,9/10 - Despite how many years the game carries behind it's back, it's still one of the pleasent games that I continue to play, even with it's out-of-date graphics. A must play if you are in to city-building and if you are in to history and it's mythological nature.

34049976.review:
Ah ! Le Maître de l'Olympe !

Que de joie de le voir débarquer sur Steam et donc d'aquérir beaucoup plus facilement son extension, et donc d'enfin pouvoir faire des cartes ! En plus les apports de cette extension valent le coup.

Plus globalement, c'est un jeu pionnier dans la gestion de villes, qui peut être plus intéressant qu'un Sims City, puisqu'ici on gère 100% des bâtiment, case par case, plutôt que de simplement délimiter des zones (je ne dis pas que c'est moins bien, mais que ça demande au final moins d'implication). En plus, on doit gérer l'import et l'export de ressources, ainsi que la diplomatie avec les autres cités de sa carte.

Bien sûr, ce jeu n'est pas parfait. Tout simplement, il y a l'agacement de voir le "voulez-vous quitter la Grèce ?" quand on appuie sur echap pour accéder aux options, soit comme dans la quasi-totalité des jeux du monde (ou sur F10 comme dans Warcraft III, même si ça reste bien plus rare), ou encore le manque de réglages possibles pour la vidéo tant le nombre de formats est déplorable, mais le gameplay aussi en prend un coup puisque même si le jeu propose une échelle de 100 sur les vitesses de jeu, il n'y a réellement qu'entre 80 et 100 qu'il y a de réelles différences, les autres vitesses étant injouables par leur lenteur. Dernière chose, la caméra est bien trop proche du sol, et il est frustrant de ne pas pouvoir faire de zoom, surtout pour dézoomer au final. C'est une petite liberté très importante pour créer un confort chez le joueur que de lui permettre d'avoir une vue d'ensemble, et aussi un facteur de satisfaction quand comme ici, on bâtit une ville : on aimerait pouvoir voir sa cité entière pour se dire "c'est moi qui y ais bâti !".

Ce sont des problèmesqui sont d'autant plus frutrant qui seraient facile à régler, se qui rendrait le jeu parfait. 
Clairement, ce jeu est tout de même malgré tout ça un must en matière de gestion, tant il est complet.

33988043.review:
Très bon jeu qui me rappelle d'excellents souvenirs. C'est un très bon city builder pour ceux qui aiment ce genre de jeu. Il y a beaucoup de paramètres à prendre ne compte pour développer sa cité : le bonheur des habitants, les approvisionner en nourriture, laine, huile d'olive, etc... On peut gérer l'économie de la cité, on peut gérer aussi le commerce et un tas d'autres paramètres. L'un des aspects sympathiques du jeu est aussi l'intéraction avec les dieux, il peuvent veiller sur vote cité ou bien vous attaquer. Ils peuvent vous demander d'accomplir certaines quêtes pour progrésser dans votre scénario.
Bref c'est un jeu très complet.

Il y a tout de même quelques bémols : le jeu n'est pour l'instant pas disponible en français donc vous pouvez installer un patch fr que vous trouverez facilement sur internet.
Et il y a aussi un problème au niveau de l'animation des dieux alliés, lorsqu'ils apparaissent, qui est dû au fait que nos machines sont trop puissantes et il faut donc limiter la puissance du processeur pour fluidifier davantage leur apparition.

Ces deux points sont tout de même mineurs si vous aimez ce genre de jeu et que vous n'êtes pas anglophobes. Je vous le recommande ;)

33235934.review:
I love this game and logged many hours into it years ago but I can't recommend it. After a few hours of troubleshooting I can safely say that it simply doesn't run on Windows 10. Those of you who were like me and wanted the nostalgia fix from this great game, save your money unless you're still running windows xp.

Update: I finally found out what was causing the issue. The intro video was cause of the continuous BSOD crashes. Deleting the BINK folder allows the game to run, but not entirely bug free. The game is apparently untouched from when it was released and contains no updates to resolution settings or to the same old gameplay bugs. Overall, I still can't recommend it since I believe games should just work without this kind of manual intervention but if these aren't deal breakers for you then you'll find the same old game waiting for you.

32732341.review:
[h1][b][i]Time flies, but this game certainly requires no further gameplay hours for me to recommend it.[/i][/b][/h1]

Somewhere around 2001-2002, my father brought back a couple of video games in PC disk format after returning home from work, one of them being [i]Zeus: Master of Olympus[/i]. Back then, I was an eight year old kid living in a cold, often rainy town near the Swiss border who had only experienced memorable console games (mainly platform and FPS genres) to kill boredom with. It was my first encounter with a historical strategy game, and boy did it rock my world.

Of course, for a young kid such as myself, it would be laughable to say I had any real grasp of effective town-management in Zeus. But the suprising thing is that you didn't really need managing skills to get fully immersed.
I can still remember the terror I'd experience when an irate deity of Olympus would send his pet monster to wreck my nascent city, or worse still, use his own godly powers on my buildings and unsuspecting townsfolk. All for the terrible crime of not building an expensive temple in his honour. 
I can also recall the fear I'd experience when some pushy enemy would send a dozen hoplite formations at my doorstep with only a few watchmen to fend them off.

Zeus was a strange, terrifying, and highly immersive world. It featured a clever combination of challenging gameplay and mythology. The voice acting was excellent. And most importantly, the music score remains one of the best I've ever heard to this date and makes up about 80% of the immersion job in this game.

As for myself, [i]Zeus[/i] instilled in me a deep interest in Greek history and mythology at a young age. It made me want to know more about Classical history. I must confess that the music from the game would immediately resonate in my head many years later while studying Greek history at university. For me, [i]Zeus[/i] [b]is[/b] Ancient Greece.

Even when I come to think of it now, this was the best-fitting game mode for the setting: A city-builder for an era of city-states.

To put it simply, this game is a gem.

30335969.review:
10/10. This game is probably in my top 3 favourite games of all time, the fact I'm actually writing a review for it alone says how much it means to me. It's a simply brilliant city builder where you can wage wars and summon Gods and Monster. 

It's a simple game that's hard to master with much depth and endless replayability. There is a ton of scenarios that I have yet to tire off, and even a mission editor with the posseidon expansion. Absolutely would recommend, to anybody who loves city builders, Greek mythology, and even has elements of an RTS. This game also taught me everything I know about Greek mythology, so it's also educational.

30143171.review: I have played Pharoah since it came out in the 90s, Emperor more recently and finally discovered Zeus/Poseidon on Steam a few days ago. It certainly lives up to the others in the series! I'd describe it as a cross between Pharoah and Emperor. The scale of the people/buildings resemble Pharoah, and the size of the maps and gameplay is more like Emperor. If you enjoyed any of the other games in the series you will enjoy this one. The gameplay is fun and challenging but easy to follow. The graphics and sound are clear and fitting to the historical period. As in Pharoah, some names of the people are puns on their profession which always raises a smile. This will be a game I play again and again through the years. The only cons are very minor - there could be more variations of the decorative structures like the parks and flower gardens, the strong American accents of the people can be a little jarring and there is little music. However these do not detract from the overall pleasure of playing this game. If you want another little historical city builder to add to your collection, this is definitely one to get.

30065250.review:
I have a confession to make...

I have this game long before steam existed and it wasn't a legal one. It was on a CD franchise called "Twilight". The Twilight series contains whole libraries of pirated games to be sold on the black market. My dad used to buy those CD's once in a while, because I was a child back then.

There was some downsides to these games though. Like I have played a Zeus game that doesn't have all the sound effects, the only sounds I heard was the clicking of the mouse and ambient noises. Even with those downsides, Zeus was one of my favourite childhood games that I kept playing through thise day. Until it came out on Steam.

For the first time, I've experienced it with music, voices and a cinematic intro! No longer will I ever play that pirated version. 

My experiences with this game is that you mostly have to plan about how you start makin' a city. My tip is that you must place your granary and storehouses at a strategic location, so you can build living districts around it. Don't forget that you storehouses around the granary must only obtain fleece and olive oil to avoid space density and build your industrial districts elsewhere.

In short: The game is easy to learn, but difficult to master.

29962867.review: This was my favourite city builder growing up, and I bought it on Steam hoping that the game-breaking bugs, the slow gods bug and staffed building animations bug had been resolved. No such luck. As it is, the game is not W10-compatible (and perhaps not even W7- or XP-compatible according to the countless forum threads on the subject of these bugs--there are workarounds that may or may not work for you, they did not for me), so thanks a lot Steam for the false advertising, and thanks license holder Activision for not giving a damn about the quality of your merchandise.

29847802.review:
Ich besitze das Hauptspiel Herrscher des Olymp - Zeus schon seit unzähligen Jahren und krame es von Zeit zu Zeit hervor um ins alte Griechenland abzutauchen. Daher scheue ich mich nicht davor, sofort ein Review zu verfassen:

Nach vielen Jahren auf meiner verzweifelten Suche nach Poseidon, dem Addon zu Herrscher des Olymp - Zeus und vielen ernüchternden Rückschlägen durch sogenannte Raritätsverkäufer auf Ebay oder Amazon (70 Euro aufwärts, wth...) gibt es den alten Klassiker nun endlich auf Steam! Mein Herz sprang mir vor Freude förmlich aus der Brust, als ich den Titel heute früh im Shop zum ersten Mal entdeckte. 16 Jahre nach der Veröffentlichung ist sowohl das Hauptspiel Herrscher des Olymp - Zeus als auch das Addon Herrscher von Atlantis - Poseidon gemeinsam unter dem Namen "Zeus + Poseidon" am 15.12.2016 in Steam angekommen. Installiert man einen deutschen Sprachpatch steht dem nostalgischen Vergnügen nun wirklich gar nichts mehr im Weg! Das sind definitiv die besten 10 Euro, die ich je für ein Spiel ausgegeben habe. Deshalb heißt es für mich ab jetzt auch endlich wieder:

"Ein Königreich für einen Grill, auf dem ich meine Feinde rösten kann!" und 
"Hat jemand meinen Speer gesehen? Wie soll ich einen Speerträger spielen, wenn ich keinen Speer habe?!"

29836618.review:
This is a great game! I played this game along time ago and just recently found it on the steam store. The core mechanics of building, city managment and mythology is amazing. I prefer playing this game over many other city building games like City Skylines. While it's an old game and the graphics are definitely not complex, it has a stellar aesthetic to it (the sort of pixel art look you get with terraria, stardew valley or minecraft). It has the city building, utilites managment and urban development parts of many traditional city sims, but it additionally has international relations, trade and military aspects of some RTS games. Additionally, I enjoy the whole atmosphere of the game greatly and the stories (despite bad voice acting) certainly add to it. Would recommend 7/11 IGN.

(If a sequel is ever made, don't go and "update the graphics". Go for the pixel art look)

29833680.review: It's no Caesar 3 but it's a fun game in it's own right. In depth campaigns and three open-ended sandbox modes give you all the game you could ever want.

29814986.review:
10/ 10 

Zues was one of my favorite games to play when i was younger, pretty sure i still have the disks too!.. I was so happy to see this game on steam.

This is still a geat game but i think most people who will end up buying this have played back in the day. 

Starts up quick but sometimes forces the window to minimize.. no big deal though.
some bugs but who really cares... its ZUES + POSEIDON g dang it

29760996.review:
First of all i am the owner of this game in physical form, in GOG and in Steam. (real hours played are x10 more)
So i ll try to be as objective as possible as I think this game one of the top 5 i have ever played.(I am an all around player pc+consoles since 1995)
Some things about the game:
    The game was published by Impressions Games / Activision in 2000;and its the mental successor of Ceasar 3 and Pharaoh and Cleopatra games that came out in 1999.
    While Ceasar has ancient Roman setting and Pharaoh ancient Egyptian; Zeus is about ancient Greece.
    Game is extremely addictive.(you have been warned)
  
Pros
[list]
    [*]The campaign is split in different scenarios making you "Build" various ancient Greek cities ( depending the city you get military, economy win, and different raw materials and allies/enemies and overall difficulty)
    [*] Due to the nature of the game the sprites while not being HD they do not look horrible like other games from that era.
    [*] Game is less than 1 GB in filesize and uses "old school "save system with a directory and save files in it. You can cross transfer your saves from to GOG to Steam and vice versa (done it myself).
    [*] Game is playable in windows 7 and windows 10.(checked)
    [*] No DLCS! everything that was ever published for the game is there. Poseidon was the official expansion for Zeus ; adding missions that have lots of water and new buildings/heroes to the existing ones.
       On main menu you choose if you are going to play Zeus on Poseidon - aka you cannot play Zeus campaign maps with Poseidon units/buildings.
  [/list]

Cons
[list]
    [*]The game supports only the following resolutions :Full screen 800 x600 and 1024x768 and window mode.There is an unofficial patch for higher resolutions but when i installed it i couldnt click on anything on main menu.
    [*]The Gods when they appear on the map and when they are fighting for you (e.x a monster) have ultra slow animation.
    [*]Steam overlay does not work correctly on the game. If someone speaks to you on chat you have to alt-tab to see the message.
    [*]The cheats work randomly.
    [*]The default animation speed (in options ) is 90% ; if you put it to 100% the speed of units is so fast that you want to vomit.So it is usable for a limited time before passing out :)
   [/list]

*Edit 24-11-2017 - with some online searching you can find additional maps/scenarios even full campaigns to enrich your experience.*

People are still playing it in 2017.Not that many games can boast this achievement.These HUNDREDS OF MILLIONS of people that have played this game CANT BE WRONG! BUY IT TODAY!
Crossing my fingers for a Zeus II or ZEUS HD remake.

29647615.review: 歷來城市系列最好玩的一部，可防守之外，也可出外征服別的城邦。放養的羊和種植的葡萄術、橄欖比起正方型農場不受地型限制，比較方便。

29555220.review:
When I was six I played this game for hours. I didn't read the instructions so I was bad at it.

17 years later, I'm still kinda bad at it....but nostalgia, soild gameplay and greek puns will always keep me coming back. 

Has anyone seen my spear? How can I be a spear carrier without my spear?

29548831.review: I love this game. I still remember how I played this game when I was a kid. Game is very simple, but for new players it might be a little hard if they don't know what they should do to make their city bigger and have a decent income. If player want their city to flourish they need to have food, good hygiene in the city, building materials for the temples, agoras for the shops, enough warehouses and granaries, industrial buildings for production, trade with other cities, good culture and beautiful decorations (yes you readed it right). Otherwise workers won't move in to players city and houses won't upgrade. There's also battle element in the game, but it's also very simple in this game: if monster attacks you need a hero to kill it so build a Hero Hall and do all the requirements to get the hero to move in to your city, if god attacks you need a stronger god to beat him/her so build a temple and if some other city attacks just order your soldiers to attack. Once the player gets their economy balanced there's pretty much nothing to do in game anymore. 8/10

29503710.review:
Pros: 
- One of the best from the bygone era of city builder simulators 
- Challenging due to the amount of surprises that pop up especially when things seem to go well
- Does not take up so much system resources even with such a wide scope 
- Quick download time even with patchy net connection since the files are less than 1GB 
- Hidden lines poking fun at Greek mythology and culture along with things outside the universe of Greek mythology *cough*Chimera*cough*

Cons: 
- Gods are very glitchy but not game breaking 
- Bits of your life get lost while playing it

29391803.review: One of the best city builders of the old era, now on Steam.  I've been waiting for a long time to be able to get this on Steam, and now here it is!

28873803.review: I played this game in high school over and over again and I am thrilled it is on Steam! Really fun city builder game with challenges like greek monsters invading and you summoning greek heros to defend your city. Graphics are pleasing to tge eye and sound effects add atmosphere.

Es ist ziemlich Ruhig und man kann genüsslich sein eigenes Athen bauen, wenn man mag und mit anderen Städten in seiner Umgebung handel treiben oder aber diese zu seine Sklaven machen und hier und dort gegen eine Gottheit kämpfen oder mehrere. ;)

28843550.review: One of the 1st games I ever got, I can not express how happy I am to get this gem on Steam. Still have my original disc tucked away as a trophy. 10/10 nostalgia

28829370.review:
Игра моего детства. С пяти лет в нее играл. Действительно, Zeus + Poseidon та игра, в которую должен сыграть каждый. Отличные квесты по множеству эпизодов, занимающие по 3-10 часов выполнения, которые действительно интересно выполнять. Некоторые очень сложные и ты ждешь, ты пытаешься его выполнить побыстрей, чтобы увидеть что будет дальше.

Что насчет графики, я не жалуюсь. Да, я люблю красивую графику, но в этой игре - это не самое главное, главное - погружение, ты можешь играть в нее часами не заметив этого.

Хочу отметить так же несколько минусов. Они не относятся к геймплею, к графике и т.д., они относятся к карточкам и достижениям.
Добавили хотя бы карточки с достижениями...Неужели так трудно? Достижения можно спокойно придумать, построить 10.000 домов, набрать 1к, 2к, 5к, 10к, 15к, 20к жителей...Пройти каждый квест, за каждый квест по достижению...Неужели так сложно??

В этой игре продумано абсолютно все, анимация каждого персонажа, их пути, каждой постройки, каждого монстра, героя, Бога и т.д. Я не знаю как мне еще описать эту игру, но в нее должен поиграть каждый. Не знаю как насчет "мелкого" поколения, но мне 20 лет и я вырос на этой игре. Она стоит своих 600 рублей, хотя я по скидке ее покупал за 360. Очень удивился когда она в стиме вышла.

10 из 10!!!

28803849.review: I feel old now this is immortal city builder

28802215.review:
Zeus + Poseidon is a old classic from back in the early sim days.  If you have not gathered by the names alone.  This game places you in the universe of greek mythology.  You are the new ruler of famous greek cities.  You build them, make temples for various gods, summon heros to battle monsters, work around and surive natural and godly disasture and protect your city from other hostle cities.  

Ok, so this is the game.  Before you buy take into account this is an old game.  Well over 15 years old.  I got it cause it was one of my favorite games back in the day and can be addictive.  It is a lot of fun if you like sim/city management games.  The little people also have lines of spoken diologe along with the gods.  The graphics are a little dated but considering a lot of the "indie/early access" games coming out lately.  The graphis are on par.  

I love this game.  It was fun 15 years ago.  It is still fun.  It can even be a good challenge most of the time.  One map I was on was small with little room to build a city.  I had to also had less room to build if I wanted to prevent Talos (greek iron golem guy) from distroying my stuff.  I also had to work around the requirements needed to summon a hero to defeat Talos.  He required several battle ship ports which required lots of workers as well as elite horse soldiers in my city.  Elite housing took up space and did not provide extra workers.  Not to mention they require all the luxuries.  So basically I had to design a very tight and compact city to get me as many workers I could.  While leaving enough room to build luxary estates for the rich upperclass and keep them happy.  Doing all this on a small map while avoiding the attenion of a monster who would destroy everything I built.  

This was just one part of ONE adventure set you could do.  In the Zeus game.  That's not even part of the Poseidon expantion that included more stuff to build, pyramids, and even more challenges.  

LOVE THIS GAME!

28790350.review: I bought this game on steam as I could not get it to run from CD with windows 10, now it does. My only complaint is that it does not have the Zeus map editor only Posidon which is a shame, hope that a download from steam will fix this.

28766948.review: Amazing game from my youth. I've burned through 3 discs of this game it is that good. Now I have bought it again digitally. BUY IT!!!!!

28756159.review:
Früher habe ich dieses Game gesuchtet nun wird es wieder gesuchtet!!!!

28746218.review:
Oh boy, oh boy...

It finally happened. One of my top 5 games of all time recently got released on Steam. I can't tell you how many hours I've spent playing the main Zeus & Poseidon campaigns, let alone the custom-made ones. 

The pinnacle of city builders that started with Sierra and ended with Impressions Games: The Caesar series, Pharaoh (& Cleopatra), Zeus (& Poseidon), Emperor - Rise of the Middle Kingdom, and even Children of the Nile (even though I never quite got into it). Pharaoh is also available in Steam now, so make sure you check it out, too!

As for Zeus - If you want the ultimate experience, make sure you get the following things right (you don't have to, of course, but they make the game run much better on modern systems):

[b] 1. Widescreen fan-made Patch [/b]
-Download the following file: http://www.wsgfmedia.com/jackfuste/Zeus/Zeus.7z
-Extract it.
-Choose the folder with the resolution you want
-Copy paste the files in the Zeus installation directory (overwrite the default ones)
-Make sure you set the resolution while ingame to 1024x768, as that will trigger the patch. That's it.

[b] 2. The slow god animation bug fix (not everyone experiences it equally badly, though) [/b]
-Download Cheat Engine: http://www.cheatengine.org and start it.
-Start Zeus, alt-tab to Cheat Engine, and select Zeus from the apps.
-On the right side, there's a speed hack option. Enable it and set the value to 1 or 2.
After this, the game will run a bit slower, like back when it was released - which is actually what you want. Don't forget that after this, you can still change the ingame speed (90% works fine in all cases I've come across so far. It's neither very fast, nor slow).

[b] 3. Lots and lots of custom-made campaigns/adventures [/b] http://zeus.heavengames.com/downloads/lister.php?category=adventures_pos 

It's amazing to see there are people who are still working on custom-made campaigns. They also pay attention to the stories, so many of the campaigns feel like an integral part of the game. Seeing as there are new adventures coming out, it's fair to say that this game is eternal!

*Lastly, I will copy a post explaining how to install the custom adventures:
"If you are downloading from the Zeus download page, there will be either a Y (indicating that it is an adventure requiring Poseidon Expansion pack), or an N (indicating it does not require the expansion). Secondly, you must create a folder with the EXACT name of the pak. file in the Adventures folder. Then extract all files to the newly created folder. Also, then you must copy the pak. file directly to the adventure folder itself. Just keep at it. I know it's confusing and a little aggrevating. I had this problem myself, and it took a few tries before I realized what I needed to be doing."

Still, even if downloading custom adventures sounds too complicated, don't worry. Both Zeus and Poseidon have more than enough content to keep you going for days/weeks/months... There's even a sandbox mode where you can build cities and please the gods to your heart's content! It's the perfect combination of city building, monument building, resource management and humor. Believe me, there's lots of humor to be found while admiring the streets of your Ancient Greek cities! 

I'm sure I've spent hundreds of hours playing this gem. Now, I will only make those hours visible for others to see, all thanks to Steam! :D

28734134.review:
Endlich gibt es das Spiel auch auf Steam. Bei "Herrscher des Olymp - Zeus" (oder Englisch "Zeus - Master of Olympus" bzw. einfach "Zeus + Poseidon" für die Version inklusive Erweiterung "Herrscher von Atlantis - Poseidon") handelt es sich um ein Einzelspieler City Builder Spiel, welches aufgrund seines einfachen aber dennoch sehr spaßigen Spielprinzips  überzeugen kann. 

Das Spiel ist schnell erlernt, man kann innerhalb von Abenteuern oder Sandbox Spielen verschiedene griechische Städte aufbauen und beim Gedeihen zusehen. Die Abenteuer Szenarien sowie die im Spiel angerissene Götter Welt ist sehr nah an der griechischen Mythologie gesidelt, weshalb man tatsächlich nebenbei spielerisch sehr viel darüber lernt. Eine Besonderheit des Spiels ist, dass die Bewohner der Stadt, im Speziellen eben die verschiedenen Berufe durch die Straßen wandern und sehr informative, wie auch humorvolle Aussagen von sich geben, sobald man auf diese klickt. Diese Aussagen geben einem vor allem Hinweise darauf, wie sich die Bewohner fühlen, also besonders auch, woran es deiner Stadt mangelt. Kernprinzip des Spiels ist es zu Wirtschaften. Als direkte Ressource gibt es nur Drachmen als Geldeinheit, mit der man haushalten muss. Sonst sind die Ressourcen eher lokal angelegt: heißt, Gebäude besitzen einen bestimmten Funktionsradius und sind effektiver, wenn sie nah beieinander platziert werden. Ein Lebensmittelhändler braucht also einen nahen Bezug zu einem Silo, und kann nur einen bestimmten Teil der Stadt beliefern. Die Häuser entwickeln sich Stufe für Stufe und verlangen mit der Zeit verschiedene andere Ressurcen, neben bestimmten Gütern wie Öl und Wein beispielsweise auch Kultur, welche durch vorbeilaufende Athleten, Schauspieler und Rednern (oder in der Erweiterung auch Wissenschaftler) in der Stadt verteilt wird. Für mich ist dieses Spiel ein absoluter Klassiker, welchen ich regelmäßig mal wieder spiele und noch genauso liebe wie am ersten Tag. Es wird einfach nicht langweilig. 

Leider sind die Versionen, die als digitaler Download verfügbar sind, ausschließlich auf Englisch verfügbar und grafisch ist das Spiel eben auf dem Niveau von 2001, also gar ohne Unterstützung von 16:9 Auflösungen und generell sehr pixelig. Beide Mankos lassen sich aber durch von Nutzern erstellte Patches etwas entkräften, sodass man diesen etwas in die Jahre gekommenden Klassiker immernoch weitesgehend genießen kann (siehe unten). 

Ich kann es nur jedem empfehlen, dieses Spiel (oder die anderen, sehr ähnlichen Ableger der Sierra City Builder Reihe) einmal auszuprobieren. Für mich persönlich ist Herrscher des Olymp - Zeus eines der besten, wenn nicht sogar das beste Spiel überhaupt. Für mich ist es unvorstellbar, weshalb man sich erst jetzt dazu entschlossen hat, das Spiel überhaupt auf Steam zu veröffentlichen, oder weshalb man nie mehr aus der großartigen Reihe gemacht hat. Seit der Übernahme von Activision 2014 wäre dies eigentlich längst überfällig gewesen. Es gibt leider keine aktuellen Spiele, die sich auch nur annäherend damit messen können. Der neuste und letzte Ableger der Serie (Ceasar IV, 2006) war aber ja leider aufgrund der Abkehr von den die Serie definierenden Spielelementen sehr schlecht, weshalb man diese wahrscheinlich auch begraben hat.. 

Empfohlene Downloads: 
Deutsches Sprachpaket - https://www.validstrategies.com/filebase/file/21-zeus-und-poseidon-german-language-pack/ 
HD Resolution Patch - http://www.moddb.com/mods/zeus-and-poseidon-full-hd-enfr#

28663801.review:
Erstes Review(von Mir),

Habe das Spiel schon vor Jahren kennen gelehrnt und ich fande es fürher schon Klasse. Und jetzte habe ich es beim Winter-Steam-Sales bekommen mit den komplet Paket von Hersteller und freuhe mich zum zweiten mal für mich, ist es eine Mischung aus alten Siedler und (Age of Empirers) aber auf alter Engiens was aber den vorteil hat das es überall flüssig läuft auch auf den Arbeits Läppi. Die Grafik ist kein HD aber sehr schön Desingt mit Details.
Als Genre würde ich es als Historik Stratigie in Zeiten des Grichenzeit mit Aufbau ,Handel und Kriegsoption mit grischichen Göttern bezeichnen.

+ :
- Läuft überall
- Stradegie Aufbau, Handel, Krigsoptien
- Götteroption (wer mal schon immer Götter steuern wollte)
- kein HD aber aber schön old Desingt mit Details ^^
- komplet in DEUTSCH! mit den einzelnen Figur (wie Stronghold) muss aber Runtergeladen werden steht im                             Diskusionsforum der Link oder Google 
-Schwierigkeit: mittel Schwere und an den Singel Kampaniege hat man schon was zu tuhn (meine Meinung)

-: 
- Steam meint das es nicht in Deutsch ist komplet falsch Spachpaket runterladen von validstrategies website spass haben
- kein full Hd und wenig Auflösungs Option aber Vollbild ^^
- erstmal krtz ins Spiel rein finden
- (nur) so viel Option wie bei Classischen Stratigie Spiel, macht es aber Übersichlicher

28657503.review:
Great city builder classic. It takes a lot of planning and sometimes the little things can destroy your city, unless you react quickly (e.g. you export too much of your food, people don't have anything to eat and leave the city and then there's nobody to deliver the food to the houses so even the most loyal people start leaving).

The game lags sometimes for a second or two. Some of the god animations take several seconds to play and by default the resolution sucks (out of the three issues, the resolution is easily fixable with a fan made patch). The game is around 17 years old at this point though.

I played the original Zeus game, but this one is with the Poseidon expansion pack, which I haven't played yet, so I got the game pretty much 2 seconds after I saw it on Steam. The current price tag (7.79mBTC for me, 4.66mBTC on sale) seems a bit high for a game that is this old, so I most likely wouldn't recommend this over a newer strategy/city builder game.

28647848.review: A bit buggy, the graphics didn't age well, but still as good as I remembered it to be.

28512490.review:
Although I was very excited to see this re-release, unfortunately I discovered an animation bug that apparently affects all relatively new computers. Most of the time, this is cosmetic; gods especially suffer. All their actions go at a snail's pace. This would be annoying, but not gamebreaking, except for the fact that this bug affects urchin harvesters as well. This makes any mission where you have to rely on urchins as a primary food source virtually unwinnable. Unless this gets patched (and from what I read, activision really has no desire to do so), I sadly cannot recommend this version of the game.

Edit: there is a fan fix for the bug in the comments! Although activision is still less than stellar, the game is now worth buying in my opinion!

28476143.review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel damals schon geliebt. Ich freue mich riesig das es jetzt endlich auf Steam ist.
Es ist ein extrem süchtig machendes Aufbauspiel. Wenn man einmal alle möglichkeiten die man hat herausgefunden hat, dann kann man garnicht mehr aufhören seine Stadt immer weiter zu optimieren.
Für Anfänger ist es aber einigermaßen schwer rein zu kommen denke ich. Ich gibt zwar ein Tutorial aber gerade die vielen kleinen Eingreiffunktionen wie zb. die Verteilung von Arbeitern oder die Stillegung von bestimmten Industrien habe ich damals auch lange nicht gefunden.
Leicht zu lernen und schwer zu meistern.

28416866.review:
I already own the CD version of those games, so I used an old save to make tests on it. 

The game itself is great even if it is old .There is no doubt on that.
But the game got a lot of running problems and  lot of new glitchs due to the new  windows O.S.; it is impossible to make it work well on new computers. Even on windows xp there is bugs.
The most disturbing one, is not the bad screen resolution or the running too fast game, not it is the...
DREADED SLOW GODS BUG, making gods, one of the most important part of the gameplay, useless. 

This bug is well know and has no real fix to it, i bought the game on steam thinking that they would had fix it. But no! They sell to you a 15 years old game which need a 15 years old computer to run well! They didn't even bother to make it run on actual computer and did you see the price they are selling it ???

I am sorry, but even for a great game as this one, this is a shame. Refund.

EDIT //////

Don't be fool by the people who commented; I love this game and my problem is not with it; the problem is that it is not suited to run on modern processor and, people dare, on 2016 to publish it again without any fix and at a price of $10. Just to earn more money without doing anything; they found old games and said to themselves; let's just publish this old game on steam; its somehow get a fanbase who are going to put the price to get it and we don't need to do shit; easy money. 

To answer to some comments;
I bought the game on GOG and all the problems are the same and remains; go on every forum and fan base about the game and you will see. The game has no real working patch who work for every one, the trick with cheat engine is a trick; it's just about activating the spead hack but it is not %100 solving the problem of gods and create others; very recently there is a new trick with  BES (Battle Encoder Shirase) but again, even if it is working even more than the cheat engine trick; it still one and it is only approching the original gameplay not equaling it.

28415780.review: This is one of the best city building games that was made about ancient Greece, the mix of classic greek mythology, and city building is one of the best blends that ive ever seen. i used to play this game back when it first came out at a friends place and i have only played as a torrent recently. the fact that they re-released this game is mind blowing. as the game starts out rather easy and becomes more challenging later one within each story, as well as the later stories, it sets you up for the challenge eager and excited to see what happens next. lots of the stories are based around those myths in which you have to build sanctuaries to get these heros to defeat the mythical creatures, along with building temples to gods and goddess to aid you in combat or in resource gathering or crafting as the main goal of the game is to create a flourishing city that either generates staples goods needed by your citizens or importing them, while balancing cultural needs for them being athletics, science and theatre. as a Grade 8 social studies teacher teaching ancient Greece at the moment, i cannot express the excitement that i have that i get to replay this game after all these years. and at this price you would have to have a cognitive delay to not buy it.

28414840.review: One of the best classic city building game. Played alot many years ago. So glad to see it released on steam.

28411716.review: Gute Reife! Wie ein guter Wein!

28410619.review:
I bought this game 30s after I saw it is on Steam. Just buy.

UPDATE: Read before buying >>>
Game is the same release as GoG one, it's not "special" refreshed release. Yes it have a speed-clock bug, no HD textures, animations of some gods are broken. 
Yes, it is playable just fine, no crushes or anything.

============================

Classic city-builder game, one of the games that is easy to begin, hard to master.

There is a lot of to look out in this game.
Player is responsible for planning routes to deliver goods to citizens, make sure that this goods are stored properly, manufactured fast enough to satisfy demand. 
One crucial thing is that level of needs for our city is getting higher and higher as game progress.
I recommend this game for any fan of strategy-build mashup genre.

+ Very fun game to play
+ One of classic city-builders that still runs
+ HD resolution via MOD = http://www.moddb.com/mods/zeus-and-poseidon-full-hd-enfr
+ Some education value (historical and mythical events)

- Redundant after few hundreds of hours
- Can be hard for newcomers of genre
- Old game = deprecated graphics that not everyone likes
- Same version without refreshed content for new generation of PC's.

28409700.review:
I love this game.
When I was a child, I played the game for free and I was not able to buy it, I had no money and didn't know where to buy it in my country.
Now I am so surprised to see it on steam. I won't miss this chance especially it is on sale.
If anyone was in the same situation as me, this is your best chance to own it, to bring your memory back!!

28408546.review: Good old games ! 2000 rausgekommen jetzt nach 16 jahren immernoch Top und extrem geil ! Wusste in der Grundschule mehr über Griechische geschichte / mythologie als sonst irgendwas das spiel ist einfach der hammer !

28403503.review: Good old classic game, enough said. I have played this game countless hours ten years ago. So far, my lifetime favorite Greek city building game. It was first released in 2000 and now re-released on Steam in 2016. It's exactly the same game and only supports 800x600 and 1024x768, no noticable changes, no Full HD nor 4K support (Though, there's a mod patch that can make it runs on higher resolutions [url=http://www.wsgf.org/forums/viewtopic.php?p=135498&sid=5f74f95b2c8ca180f5cb404952562de1#p135498] Here [/url]), and it's english only at the moment. But all in all, good old game. Bought it at first glance. Old school city builder (aka city path planner) in Greek theme with Greek gods, monsters, and their timeless myths.

Seriously, this game is my childhood, thousands of hours. I still ahve the original manual, its about the size of a peperback. I bought it the second I saw it on steam and expet to play it a lot more after finals.

28393441.review:
Had to pick this up as soon as I saw it made it to Steam, I played this all the time as a kid.

As a game, I think Zeus is a blast. Nice classic city building game with a nice greek theme. Manage your agoras, construct temples to the Gods, and war with your fellow city states. Age hasn't been kind to the game, and I'd be much more hesitant to recommend this to someone who hasn't already played and enjoyed it, but it still stands out to me as a fun and charming classic.

Technically speaking, the game runs fine if a bit fast on current hardware, no widescreen support or much in the way of settings to speak of.

39483237.review: Still one of the best city builders, I will never tire of this game.
